events.content: Created context handover document for next session - deployment instructions for osmotic/wherewasi to Cloudflare Pages, miqro Astro design direction with audio theme
Context handover document created - deployment roadmap for osmotic/wherewasi to Cloudflare Pages plus miqro.dev Astro design plan

Built qoins - philosophical budget app with AI trading companion QOIN that tries to pay its own server costs. Complete with personality system, trading logic, and social media potential. Ready for viral deployment.

Developed comprehensive social media strategy for QOIN AI - targeting Bluesky, Reddit wallstreetbets, with philosophical trading content. Ready for viral deployment with honest financial failure as content strategy.

QOIN social media strategy evolved into full meme potential - wallstreetbets diamond hands culture, future QOIN.QOIN token jokes, perfect viral crypto parody content. Ready to send AI philosopher TO THE MOON

QOIN evolution: 'The advice is: don't' - perfect AI trading philosophy. Planning legal review for social accounts + trading, website concept mixing dry robot philosophy vs wallstreetbeets ape culture memespeak

Created ultimate WSB-style website for QOIN - complete chaos with floating diamonds/rockets, rainbow text, ape translations of robot philosophy, legal disclaimers as memes, and Konami code easter egg. Pure hedonistic memespeak glory.

Smart pivot: QOIN stays simulated trading - real value is the joke/entertainment, not actual money. Automated trading has regulatory complexity, most value in philosophical AI comedy concept without financial risk.

GENIUS IDEA: QOIN as trader's tamagotchi - live line chart with robot head at current position, speech bubbles for trades/feelings, incremental game mechanics. Like Cookie Clicker meets trading, perfect addictive engagement model.

Built incredible QOIN Tamagotchi trading game - live chart with animated robot head, speech bubbles, incremental game mechanics, achievements, upgrades, mood system. Like Cookie Clicker meets TradingView meets pet care. Perfect addictive engagement.

Completed QOIN Tamagotchi game! Live trading chart with animated robot head that moves along line, speech bubbles with philosophical trading commentary, mood system, interactive controls. Perfect addictive pet game for traders.

GENIUS EVOLUTION: Meta-incremental progression unlocks multiple trading bot personalities (HODL-DROID, DIP-DESTRUCTOR, BEARBOT), Create-A-Bot customization, portfolio management strategy layer. Educational trading sim disguised as shitpost game!

INCREDIBLE INSIGHT: Bots trade with EACH OTHER creating internal market that grows and bubbles until inevitable crash back to one bot! Perfect market cycle/bubble education through gameplay. Boom, bust, reset with wisdom intact.

PIVOT TO FULL DEVELOPMENT: Building the complete QOIN incremental trading game. Creating comprehensive documentation, tech stack planning, context handover for development phase. Budget app becomes side feature.

Created comprehensive context handover documentation - README and full development context covering game design, technical architecture, educational framework, monetization, and roadmap. Ready for implementation phase.
Fixed critical TradingEngine syntax error blocking game - duplicate tick() methods caused 'TradingEngine is not defined'. Game now loads and initializes properly.
Strategic decision: Rebranded from QOIN to QOINbots for clearer game focus. Registered qoinbots.com domain, positioned as standalone incremental game rather than budget app tie-in.
Major project cleanup for production readiness - removed backend/obsolete files, simplified to client-side only, created build.sh for Cloudflare Pages deployment, added SEO meta tags.
QOINbots successfully pushed to GitHub (QRY91/qoinbots), production build system ready, configured for Cloudflare Pages deployment to qoinbots.com domain.
Simplified development workflow - replaced confusing multiple launch scripts with single ./play.sh command. Clear path from local development to production deployment.

Session summary: QOINbots production deployment preparation - Fixed critical syntax bug, rebranded project, cleaned infrastructure, pushed to GitHub. Ready for Cloudflare Pages deployment to qoinbots.com. Next: Deploy live game and test production functionality.

QOINbots core gameplay loop achieved - real-time trading with 100ms UI updates, visual feedback, and addictive mechanics working. Bot trades every 2-8 seconds with immediate balance animations and notifications.

Strategic decision: Migrate QOINbots UI to Svelte while preserving game engine - vanilla JS state management has become unwieldy, Svelte will provide reactive UI with existing Bot/GameState/TradingEngine classes intact.

Solved QOINbots bot trading stopping issue - reduced minimum trade size to $0.25, added emergency funding system, improved balance management, and comprehensive debug logging. Bots now trade consistently.
QOINbots UI made near real-time - 1000ms → 100ms update intervals, 250ms trading engine ticks, floating balance change indicators, flash animations. Creates proper 'trading floor' feeling.
QOINbots development pattern: vanilla JS works for game logic but state management becomes unwieldy for complex UI. Svelte migration will preserve working core while modernizing reactive layer.
Created comprehensive Svelte migration handover document for QOINbots - complete 4-phase migration plan preserving all working game logic while modernizing UI layer to reactive components.
Beginning Svelte migration for QOINbots - Analyzed current vanilla JS architecture with game engine, UI layer, and working bot system. Ready to follow phased migration plan.
Phase 1 complete: Svelte project structure created with Vite, game engine files copied from original, CSS migrated. Ready for reactive stores setup.
Phase 2 complete: Created comprehensive Svelte stores with reactive state management, built main App component with game initialization logic and responsive layout structure.
Svelte development environment confirmed working - Vite dev server running successfully. Created LoadingScreen and Header components with animations and reactive stores integration.

Phase 3 milestone: Fixed ES6 exports for all game engine files and updated to Svelte 5 mount API. Created comprehensive component structure with LoadingScreen, Header, Chart, BotRoster, EventFeed, TradeNotifications, and Modal components.

Critical fix: Changed TradingEngine to extend EventEmitter instead of EventTarget to provide .on() method for event handling. Fixed game initialization by properly passing gameState to TradingEngine constructor and corrected bot personality reference.

QOINbots Svelte 5 migration COMPLETE! Successfully migrated from vanilla JS to Svelte 5 with working app on localhost:3003. All components created, reactive stores implemented, game engine preserved. App loads but game logic needs activation - bot trading, events, market simulation need connection to Svelte stores. Ready for continued development.
Successfully transitioned QOINbots from vanilla JS to Svelte frontend - build system updated, Svelte app compiles and loads, but graph activity needs investigation
Investigating QOINbots Svelte graph activity issue - found event listener mismatch between App.svelte expecting 'trade' events vs TradingEngine emitting 'bot_trade' events, fixed event names
QOINbots Svelte UI working - bot activation/deactivation shows in feed, but trading engine not executing trades - need to debug trading logic and tick system
Added comprehensive debug functions to QOINbots Svelte version - window.qoinDebug provides listBots, checkTradingConditions, forceTrade functions to diagnose trading engine issues
Cleaning up QOINbots project structure - removing obsolete vanilla JS frontend, updating play.sh to use Svelte version
i'm starting to do multiple prompts at a time, for different projects. this can quickly get out of hand, but it's fun getting better at switching context and covering a lot of ground solo.

Journey Replay Feature - Created comprehensive implementation plan with 6-week timeline aligned to PostHog application goals. Feature will transform uroboro into development storytelling platform with animated timeline visualization.
QOINbots project cleanup complete - play.sh now launches Svelte version, old frontend archived, clear dev workflow established with debug tools
Found root cause of QOINbots trading issue - TradingEngine missing Bot class import, causing 'Bot is not defined' error when trying to create bot instances
Fixed QOINbots trading issue - added missing Bot import to TradingEngine.js, trading should now work properly

Started Journey Replay feature development - Created dedicated branch feature/journey-replay, committed implementation plan and AI session procedure
Fixed Bot.js export issue - added missing 'export default Bot' statement, TradingEngine can now properly import and instantiate Bot class
Git commit: juggle gitignore
Git commit: add procedure files to gitignore
QOINbots trading is now working! Bot making trades (512 total, 277 wins), but bot_trade event listener has getBots().find() error - getBots returns object not array
Fixed QOINbots bot_trade event listener - changed getBots().find() to getBots()[botId] and corrected bot stats property mapping, UI should now sync with trading engine

Journey Replay Phase 1 Complete - Successfully implemented core journey service, data export functionality working perfectly, generated 226 events across 16 projects from last 3 days with milestone detection
Refactoring Journey Replay to be integrated into publish command instead of separate command - keeping UX simple with 3 core commands: capture, publish, status
QOINbots trading actively working - 694 trades executed, but bot activation state may be cosmetic only, and trade.profit undefined causing toFixed() error in event listener

Journey Replay successfully integrated into publish command - Maintains 3-command simplicity while adding powerful timeline visualization: uroboro publish --journey. Export and web server modes both working perfectly

Phase 1 Complete: Core journey replay functionality operational
Fixed QOINbots trade event properties (pnl vs profit) and bot activation sync - active property now properly syncs with GameState isActive and Bot instance

PHASE 1 COMPLETE: Journey Replay Feature Foundation - Successfully implemented core journey service with timeline processing, web visualization server, database integration, and publish command integration. Real data processing working perfectly with 226+ events across 16 projects. Ready for Phase 2 web interface enhancements.
Starting branch unification - merging posthog-integration and journey-replay features to main branch for clean unified development

BRANCH UNIFICATION COMPLETE - Successfully merged posthog-integration and journey-replay features to main branch. Both PostHog analytics and Journey Replay working perfectly together. Clean unified codebase ready for continued development!

Git commit: Branch unification complete - PostHog + Journey Replay unified

- Merged feature/journey-replay: Journey Replay visualization feature
- Both features working together seamlessly
- PostHog capturing session analytics, publish events, and journey data exports

All systems operational on main branch!

Added marketing stubs for new features to landing page - 'The snake went on a journey and found a new friend!' section showcasing Journey Replay and PostHog integration. Ready to expand with full feature descriptions and demos later.

Marketing foundation in place for both major features!
QOINbots Svelte trading now fully working, but chart Y-axis auto-scaling makes market trends unreadable - need to check original vanilla JS chart implementation for better approach
Completely rewrote QOINbots chart component - now uses real market data with fixed Y-axis bounds, price history tracking, and proper timeframes instead of random mock data
QOINbots chart showing price plummet from 00 to  - need to scale up prices for better UX, big numbers more engaging than tiny decimals
Scaled up QOINbots asset prices for better UX - QOIN now 00 (vs ), HODL 500 (vs 0), MOON 5 (vs bash.001), with smart price formatting for readability

PHASE 2 MAJOR PROGRESS: Enhanced Journey Replay web interface with advanced timeline animations, progress tracking, event scrubbing, improved visualizations, and smart event positioning. Beautiful interactive timeline with playback controls!

Git commit: Phase 2: Major Journey Replay web interface enhancements

ENHANCED TIMELINE ANIMATIONS:
- Smart event positioning with lane algorithms to prevent overlapping
- Different animations for event types (milestone, learning, decision, commit)
- Entrance animations with milestone-pulse, learning-bounce, decision-flash
- Enhanced visual styling based on event types and importance

INTERACTIVE TIMELINE CONTROLS:
- Progress bar with real-time tracking of animation progress
- Timeline scrubbing - click/drag to jump to any point in journey
- Improved playback controls with visual feedback
- Event counter showing current position (X / Y events)
- Live timestamp display showing current event time

ENHANCED LAYOUT & UX:
- Timeline header with journey title and live statistics
- Visual legend showing different event types
- Timeline axis with time markers for better orientation
- Hover effects with content previews on events
- Smart Y-positioning based on lanes, importance, and randomization

TECHNICAL IMPROVEMENTS:
- Proper event state management (revealed vs hidden)
- Smooth transitions and entrance animations
- Performance-optimized rendering for 100+ events
- Responsive design with better mobile support

Phase 2 Complete: Rich interactive timeline visualization operational!
QOINbots chart pricing fixed, but need to verify event feed prices are accurate, bot stats are scaled correctly, and fix layout overlap between bot card and chart
Fixed QOINbots scaling issues - bot starting balance now 000 (vs 0) to match 00+ asset prices, improved layout spacing between chart and bot roster with proper flex proportions

QOINbots strategic decision point - low values likely from localStorage caching old 0 balances, missing reset functionality, and considering TypeScript migration for market/trading logic before adding multibot features
Starting QOINbots TypeScript migration - Phase 1: Core trading logic (Bot, TradingEngine, GameState) to prevent property mismatches and ensure data flow consistency
CI caught formatting issues - running proper deploy procedure and cleanup before pushing to main
Major TypeScript migration progress - created comprehensive type definitions, converted GameState.ts and Bot.ts with proper typing, set up TS config. Core trading logic now type-safe

AMAZING JOURNEY REPLAY VISION: Event tooltips on timeline hits, console text-feed with search, project-based vertical clustering with repulsion physics, visual connections like conspiracy maps, context-switching patterns showing development fate-weaving. Uroboro mythos enhanced!

CONSPIRACY MAP JOURNEY REPLAY COMPLETE! 🕷️ Implemented physics-based project clustering, event tooltips on timeline hits, console text-feed with search, twine-like connections between events, project repulsion physics, and full uroboro mythos theming. The loom of fate awaits!
Layout bug in Journey Replay - console visible but main timeline visualization not showing. Need to debug CSS flex layout and ensure timeline container has proper height/visibility.

UX improvement needed: 3-column layout with Projects (left) | Chart (middle) | Chronicle (right). Make sidebars collapsible and fix console height - currently too flat. Better responsive design needed.

BRILLIANT new feature idea: Video editor style timeline scrubbing with time scale selection (24hr, 60min, etc.) and viewport panning through journey data. Like solar system example - zoom into specific time windows for detailed play-by-play vs full journey overview.
